data.text:
Would you like to become involved in helping to educate the next generation of PAs?

If you would like to be contacted about any of the ways to help the hybrid program, please fill out this survey and someone from the department will reach out to you.

The Pitt Hybrid PA program is always looking for more help in the following areas:

Graders

Grading opportunities arise throughout the semester based on specific course instruction and faculty needs. Grading opportunities typical involve reviewing a written document or activity and providing student feedback in a similar method. These are not generally live activities but could be completed within your schedule. A department staff member will reach out regarding upcoming activities.

Facilitating labs/standardized patient encounters

Laboratory sessions and standardized patient (SP) encounters occur at set times throughout the curriculum. Opportunities are available to facilitate in-person labs and SP encounters. Activities will occur virtually throughout the semester and can be facilitated remotely from the campus in Oakland. Students will also spend three one-week sessions on campus throughout the curriculum with live activities occurring on the Oakland campus. A department staff member will reach out regarding upcoming activities.

Adjunct Lecturers

Upon successful completion of grading and/or facilitation activities, it is possible to become an adjunct lecturer.

Clinical Preceptors
